definition: Deadline tracking combines statutory requirements, carrier-specific patterns, and policy-based deadlines to identify critical dates and compliance requirements.

deadlineTypes.description: Deadlines required by state law or regulation
examples: Investigation completion (varies by state, typically 30-60 days)
Payment deadlines (varies by state, typically 30-60 days after approval)

deadlineTypes.description: Deadlines based on carrier-specific practices and patterns
examples: Typical response times for specific carriers

deadlineTypes.description: Deadlines specified in the insurance policy contract

redFlagIndicators: Deadline approaching with no clear resolution
Failure to acknowledge receipt of required documents
scoringGuidelines: Compare actual timelines against typical or required timeframes.
Flag approaching deadlines with sufficient advance notice.
Identify patterns of delay or missed deadlines.
Note when professional review is recommended for deadline concerns.
